entry.et: Middle English roren, from Old English rārian; akin to Old High German rērēn to bleat

def.dt: :to utter or emit a full loud prolonged sound
:to sing or shout with full force
:to make or emit a loud confused sound (as background reverberation or rumbling)
:to proceed or rush with great noise or commotion
:to make a loud noise during inhalation (as that of a horse affected with roaring)
:to utter or proclaim with a roar
:the deep cry of a wild animal (as a lion)
:a loud deep cry (as of pain or anger)
:a loud continuous confused sound the roar of the crowd
